column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Get Better at Drawing or Painting
#Text=Being artistic is a respectable talent , but it does n't come naturally to everyone .
#Text=Some of us are born to be the next Vincent van Gogh , and some of us are still working on stick figures .
#Text=This article is here to help you improve your artistic skills - no matter where on the talent spectrum you are .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Expose yourself to art .
#Text=As you learn more about different styles and art principles , you will be able to incorporate them into your own art .
#Text=Go to art museums and get art books from your local library .
#Text=Learn about art in all of its forms .
#Text=Make sure to do your research before you begin .
#Text=Practice your skills .
#Text=Draw or paint every day .
#Text=You can buy a notebook that you fill completely with doodles- just to get your creativity flowing .
#Text=It 's okay if you just do one stroke a day - just make sure to do that one stroke with an artistic flair .
#Text=Experiment freely .
#Text=If you like the flow of the sky in " Starry Night " , try to replicate it in a painting of your own .

column1: #Text=Try out any technique or style that intrigues you .
#Text=You might find that you 're a natural at a style you never tried before .
#Text=If not , that does n't mean it 's not for you .
#Text=Keep trying .
#Text=Mix styles .
#Text=See what works and what does n't .
#Text=Slowly you will begin to develop a style of your own .
#Text=Do n't fall into autopilot .
#Text=It has been said that anything you do without thinking will not be your best work .
#Text=Concentrate on your art .
#Text=Think about what you 're doing from beginning to end .
#Text=Take it slow .
#Text=Some people fly through a painting in half an hour and are frustrated by the subpar results .
#Text=Do n't rush ; even if you 're incredibly talented , trying to squeeze art into a tiny span of time will never go well .
#Text=Leave the piece for later if you need a break .
#Text=Get your own supplies .
#Text=It 's good to have them on hand instead of going to a community center or similar public place .
#Text=That way you 'll have more opportunities to create art .
#Text=For painting , you should have canvases ; normal paper shrinks and becomes malformed under paint .
#Text=Have a paint palette , a water bowl to clean your brushes , a few different types of brushes , and red , yellow , blue , white paint at least .
#Text=To darken a mixture , it 's best not to use pure black , so find a variation of black as well .
#Text=For drawing , have plenty of paper- printer paper works , but go for a drawing pad/sketchbook if you want to .
#Text=Have a good eraser and a variety of pencils : 4H , 2H , HB , 2B , 4B , and 6B , primarily .
#Text=This will give you a greater variety of potential shades to use .
#Text=If you 're on a tight budget , buy your supplies over time .
#Text=Take proper care of your supplies .
#Text=They will be no use to you otherwise .
#Text=Wash all the paint out of your brushes after use and then dry them .
#Text=Keep your pencils in a place where they will not be broken .
#Text=Practice shading and highlights to bring depth to your art .
#Text=Show your work to family and friends and ask for suggestions .
#Text=Use the suggestions to your advantage - improve what you are n't doing well .
#Text=Take an art class ... or two ... or three .
#Text=Learn tips and tricks from people who are paid to teach them .
#Text=Most importantly , do n't throw away your creativity .
#Text=It 's there , and it 's the best tool you 'll ever have .
#Text=Let it run wild , no matter how silly you feel .
